entries.title: Disgraced 'crypto king' Sam Bankman-Fried released on $250m bail - the largest in pre-trial history
entries.description: Disgraced cryptocurrency tycoon Sam Bankman-Fried has been released on a $250m (£208m) bond package as he awaits fraud charges - the largest ever pretrial bond in history.

entries.title: FIFA confirm restaurateur Salt Bae should not have been on the pitch after World Cup final
entries.description: FIFA have admitted Salt Bae should not have been on the pitch after the World Cup final.

entries.title: Sunak and Von der Leyen promise to 'work together' to break NI Protocol deadlock
entries.description: Rishi Sunak and Ursula von der Leyen have insisted they will work together to find a solution to the row over the Northern Ireland Protocol, as pressure grows  to break the diplomatic deadlock.

entries.title: Chechens fighting for Ukraine say Russians are 'like cattle for slaughter, leaving the ground covered with corpses'
entries.description: In a bunker below the fiercely contested city of Bakhmut, a jihadi commander with a half a million-dollar Russian bounty on his head, joins his men in prayer.

entries.title: Guinea-born Italian rugby star accepts apology after being given rotten banana in club's Secret Santa
entries.description: A Guinea-born Italian rugby star who was given a rotten banana in his club's Secret Santa says he has accepted an apology - but insisted: "Forgiveness... doesn't mean forgetting".

entries.title: Half of Shanghai's population of 25 million 'could have COVID by end of next week'
entries.description: A Shanghai hospital has told its staff to prepare for a "tragic battle" with COVID-19 as it expects half of the city's 25 million people will get infected by the end of next week.

entries.title: 'My power is really low': NASA set to lose contact with Mars InSight spacecraft after four years
entries.description: This may be the last ever image sent from NASA's Mars InSight spacecraft.

entries.title: Men allowed to compete in artistic swimming at Olympics for first time
entries.description: Men will be allowed to compete in artistic swimming at the Olympics for the first time in the sport's history.

entries.title: 'The Serpent' killer Charles Sobhraj set to be freed from Nepal jail
entries.description: A French murderer who admitted to killing several western tourists is due to be set free from prison in Nepal after the country's supreme court ordered his release.

entries.title: Republicans sat defiantly while all around rose in acclaim - as Ukraine hopes aid continues
entries.description: Into a buttoned-up, power-dressed chamber of US politicians entered the man of war.

entries.title: Netanyahu announces he has formed new coalition government
entries.description: Benjamin Netanyahu has said he has successfully secured a deal to form a new coalition government following weeks of negotiations with religious and far-right partners.
